dt: {bc}to {d_link|engineer|engineer:2} (something, such as a product) to have more functions, capabilities, etc. than are necessary or desirable

dt.t: The pressure to overreact to feedback … will lead many companies to {wi}overengineer{/wi} their products, until common sense kicks back in.
It was advertised to last 50 years, and {wi}overengineered{/wi} so it might last 100.
Our research steered us away from trying to design pockets and compartments for specific uses. We didn't want to {wi}overengineer{/wi}.

shortdef: to engineer (something, such as a product) to have more functions, capabilities, etc. than are necessary or desirable
